content:
Master and Doctoral Degrees http://www.oncology.ox.ac.uk Information about taught MSc Courses, MRes and DPhil (PhD) research projects with the Department of Oncology daily 1 2012-08-07T12:32:19Z Taught MSc Courses http://www.oncology.ox.ac.uk/graduate-studies/master-and-doctoral-degrees/taught-msc-courses The Department of Oncology runs a taught MSc course in Radiation Biology and contributes to the part-time MSc course in Experimental Therapeutics, which is run by the Department of Continuing Education.

]]> No publisher ndos0550 2012-07-18T09:45:00Z Feature Masters by Research http://www.oncology.ox.ac.uk/graduate-studies/master-and-doctoral-degrees/masters-by-research An MRes is a 2 year research degree in Oncology. The MRes is not a prerequisite for the DPhil in Oncology.

MRes projects are not advertised, but can be based upon either the DPhil projects which will be listed in October, or can be independantly written to complement the research interests of both the student and the supervisor's research programme.

The Department of Oncology does not provide funding for MRes study.

]]> No publisher ndos0550 2012-05-08T14:05:00Z Feature DPhil (PhD) Projects http://www.oncology.ox.ac.uk/graduate-studies/master-and-doctoral-degrees/dphil-programmes Our aim is to provide a fully integrated DPhil research training programme in Oncology & Radiobiology. In addition to the Departmentally run theoretical courses and practical courses we have an established DPhil Programme which engage students in high quality basic and clinically applied research, with the aim of training future leaders in\ufffd\ufffdthe fields of cancer biology and applied biology and radiotherapy for\ufffd\ufffdcancer. Below are the projects on offer this year. Please select up to 3 projects from this list when you apply for the Oncology Prize Studentship Competition. Interviews for DPhil studentships will be held on the 26th & 29th January, 2nd & 5th February 2015.

View all DPhil projects (printer friendly)

]]> No publisher ndos0550 2012-05-02T14:10:00Z Feature
